review: This review is for a "Fire TV Stick Streaming media HDMI stick with Netflix, Amazon Prime Instant Video, music, games, and more " paired with a 42 inch LCD TV. TV also bought from amazon, but not reviewed here.What is it: A small streaming media device based on the FireOS, Amazon’s android Port, Slightly longer than the Chromecast stick, but narrower. The box contains the stick with a charger, remote, a small HDMI extender and a microUSB cable. The device will typically update when you plug it in and connect to your Wifi. Eat a banana and wait. It comes registered to your account unless you order it as a guest. If you ordered it as your device, you are pretty much set to go. The remote has the six buttons and direction wheel/enter you will need most often. The user interface is mostly familiar to FireOS users, others will need patience. In the end, if you use amazon more than google then the stick wins.

review: TOTAL BS, Amazon.  There's no excuse for building Miracast into Fire TV and not supporting Windows.  I will be sending these back.  It's a shame too because the stick is pretty nice, but not so nice that I will keep it when I can just get a Microsoft Wireless Adapter that will work with anything that supports Miracast.  I am a LONG time Amazon Prime member and frequent purchaser of products.  I've never been this disappointed with you. Supporting some devices and not others is so old world thinking, I expect much more from Amazon.
